supporting_text: The NAP includes strategies to prevent and control infections associated with health care and to strengthen the national surveillance system for antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP outlines actions to prevent and control infections in animal production and companion animals.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of environmental factors in the emergence and spread of antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes strategies to regulate the use of antimicrobials in agriculture and promote responsible practices.
The NAP mentions the need for annual or biannual operational plans to evaluate and adjust activities.
The NAP outlines specific objectives and actions to be implemented within the 2021-2025 timeframe.
The document does not specify any budget allocation for the strategies outlined.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral committee involving various ministries for coordination.
The NAP promotes the incorporation of AMR topics into educational curricula and training programs.
The NAP includes plans for public awareness campaigns to inform the community about AMR.
The NAP acknowledges collaboration with international organizations like WHO, FAO, and OIE.
The NAP emphasizes the development of an integrated surveillance system for AMR.
The NAP includes objectives to strengthen the capacity for detection and reporting of AMR.
The NAP outlines strategies for infection prevention and control in health care settings.
The NAP refers to the need to align with OIE and FAO standards for antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes actions to regulate the prescription and use of antimicrobials.
The NAP aims to strengthen the regulatory framework for antimicrobial use.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP encourages participation in international research initiatives related to AMR.
